awd_titl_txt: Instrumentation for the Improvement of Modern Physics and   Optics Laboratories
awd_abstract_narration: The Physics Department is improving and upgrading the laboratories              associated with modern physics and optics courses.  The students                are performing experiments using modern methods of intensity and                wavelength measurements in the visible and infrared parts of the                electromagnetic spectrum.  The project involves the use of a                    monochromator, sources of optical radiation, light chopper, lock-               in amplifier and pyroelectric detector as major instruments.  This              instrumentation is being used to perform a set of experiments                   dealing with nature of light and light matter interaction.  The                 experience gained with this instrumentation enables students to use             light as a probe in experimental investigations and sharpen their               experimental skills.                                                                                                                                            The university is matching the award with an equal amount of funds.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA
